intro: Cuphea correntina, commonly known as the coral cup or red cup, is a flowering plant native to Central America. It belongs to the Lythraceae family and is characterized by its distinctive, tubular, coral-colored flowers. The plant typically grows as an annual or perennial herb, reaching heights of up to 60 cm. Its foliage consists of opposite, ovate leaves with a slightly hairy texture. Cuphea correntina is valued in horticulture for its vibrant blooms and ability to attract pollinators like bees and hummingbirds.
